title: Ticket #7119: condor_qedit reports one too many matching jobs
description:
Raytheon is reporting that condor_qedit reports the wrong number of matching jobs. This is fairly easy to reproduce: 

$ condor_submit myjob.sub
Submitting job(s).
1 job(s) submitted to cluster 1234.
$ condor_qedit 1234 TestAttribute 'test'
Set attribute "TestAttribute" for 2 matching jobs.

On further inspection is seems to always report one too many matching jobs.
remarks:
2019-Jul-05 12:16:57 by coatsworth:
The one extra match that was showing up here was the cluster ad, which was being included in the match count but not visible to users. I've changed this to count cluster ads + jobs separately. If there is more than one job match, then the job count is returned. If there are no job matches but there is a cluster match, the cluster match count is returned. If there are no matches at all, it returns an error.

2019-Aug-01 17:11:15 by johnkn:
CODE_REVIEW looks good.
check_ins:
